intro: Trichostema lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hillside flower, is a perennial herb native to western North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Trichostema lanceolatum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting pollinators.
